sub_title: Technical Data Management Analyst at Shell
summary: I am a data manager specializing in the oil and gas industry with over 10 years of experience. I am currently providing data management support to the Shell exploration team in The Hague, where my role consists of project setup and closeout, data mining and loading, transfer between applications and data sharing. I am professional and easy to work with, with a great attention to details while still staying focused on delivery. I graduated from the University of Strasbourg, specializing in geophysics and geology.

education.field_of_study: Geophysics, geology and earth system dynamics

profile_positions.description:
I am currently working as an embedded data manager for Shell International Exploration and Production in The Hague, providing direct support to the exploration geoscientists. I worked on various projects (regional study, exploration, well drilling) for different countries (Turkey, Bulgaria, Oman) and I'm focusing right now on support for the Asia team.

My responsibilities include: data mining in the various Shell repositories, project set up and close out (team onboarding, setup database and working environment with Petrel reference projects and nDI projects, final data publishing, archiving and clean up). I'm also working on data loading and transfer between applications (OpenWorks, Petrel, CDS, Recall), setup and maintaining access rights on Linux drives and SharePoint sites and organize data transfer with external companies.
profile_positions.title: Technical Data Management Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Subsurface Data Manager for Shell

I worked as an embedded data manager for Shell on various projects (regional study, exploration, well drilling) for different countries (Turkey, Bulgaria, Oman, Brunei). My responsibilities included: data mining in the various Shell repositories, project set up and close out (team onboarding, setup database and working environment with Petrel reference projects and nDI projects, final data publishing, archiving and clean up), data loading and transfer between applications, setup and maintain access on Linux drives and SharePoint sites and organise data transfer with external companies.
profile_positions.title: Data Manager

profile_positions.description:
Jan 2015 – Nov 2019
Subsurface Data Manager for Shell
Den Haag, The Netherlands

I worked as an embedded data manager for Shell exploration. My responsibilities included: data mining in the various Shell repositories, project set up and close out (team onboarding, setup database and working environment with Petrel reference projects and nDI projects, final data publishing, archiving and clean up), data loading and transfer between applications, setup and maintain access on Linux drives and SharePoint sites and organise data transfer with external companies.

In November 2019: Sword acquires DataCo: https://www.sworditsolutions.com/sword-acquires-dataco-ltd/

Sep 2012 – Dec 2014
Well Data Manager for Shell
Rijswijk, The Netherlands

I worked as a data manager in the Shell office in Rijswijk for the Well Quality Improvement Project (QIP), populating the Shell corporate database with verified non-curve data. My responsibilities included data mining, capturing, verifying and loading well data (header, time depth, directional survey, casings, cores, test data, chrono and lithostratigraphic picks) to the Shell corporate data stores.

May 2012 – Jun 2012
Well Data Manager for Addax Petroleum
Geneva, Switzerland

On this short-term assignment I worked as on on-site log joiner for a well data clean-up project for Addax Petroleum in their offices in Geneva, generating a full data set of joined, depth-matched and verified petrophysical curves according to the client standards.

Nov 2011 – Sep 2012
Well Data Manager for Shell
Aberdeen, Scotland

I worked in the Well Quality Improvement Project (Well QIP) for the Shell teams based in The Netherlands. I was responsible for producing and delivering sets of petrophysical curves that had been verified, joined and depth matched according to the client standards, to be used by the exploration geologist. Logs were to be verified against hardcopy prints, digitised if necessary and loaded to the OpenWorks and Recall databases.
profile_positions.title: Data Manager

profile_positions.description: For the research internship during the last semester of my studies I worked the formation and the evolution of the Kerguelen Plateau, a magmatic province located in the Indian Ocean, thanks to geophysical and geological data (seismic profiles interpretation, gravimetric maps, drilling, geochemistry, magnetic anomalies).
profile_positions.title: Research Internship
